Posted By: bowlofgumbo (11/13/2011 6:24:50 PM)

posts.post_content:
I started playing magic in early 1995. By that time, I've heard of Black Lotus every now & then from my friends.  
I wanted to buy one but, of course, it's too late to get one already. To think that it came out just more than a year and a half before i started buying & playing MTG.   
  
I don't think I'll live to see this card getting reprinted. Even a [Lotus Petal](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lotus Petal) is hard to find nowadays. Well, at least i got four petals in my collection. Damn, where did i put that time machine of mine. :)
posts.html:

I don't think I'll live to see this card getting reprinted. Even a Lotus Petal is hard to find nowadays. Well, at least i got four petals in my collection. Damn, where did i put that time machine of mine. :)

Posted By: hid@n (6/15/2010 5:34:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
As a long time player and owner of one of these, I think I'm qualified to comment regarding those on both sides of this issue, those who think this is the greatest card in all of magic and those who think it's terribly overrated or even flat out bad.  
  
The truth of this lies somewhere in the middle if you're going to be objective about this.  
  
Versatility wise, this is one of the few cards, that can be utilized by just about any deck...provided the person constructing the deck understands the synergy between this and his other cards and how to use it. I could easily throw this card into a deck where it would be close to useless or of minimum assistance.  
  
You still have to know how to play this game...something a lot of people don't.  
  
So this card, by itself, is not the be all and end all. It still needs other cards to win. Can it get you to where you want to go faster than any other card? Depends on the deck. I have one in one deck, with my other Power 9 cards (I have the whole set) tha... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: stille_nacht (7/16/2011 3:09:27 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Honestly, not a big fan of it. I understand completely why it's absolutely broken, but that's why I don't like it. First Turn Kills aren't fun, and should only ever be used in hyper-competitive money-situations. This card provides little more than a one-turn mega-boost, which at only three mana, can do little to actually progress the game early on UNLESS being used in some raunchy FTK combo; unless you use it to play like, mana flare or something. Good card, I'd definitely like to own one, but there are a huge list of cards I'd rather own and get much more enjoyment out of.  
   
Probably just the Spike-hating Johnny in me though, so feel free to eat me alive; I just don't find it amusing or worth my time when a whole game is just "shuffle your deck, reveal your opening hand, explain why you already won and neither person should have wasted their time or money to play glorified Rock-Paper-Scissors"
posts.html:

Good card, I'd definitely like to own one, but there are a huge list of cards I'd rather own and get much more enjoyment out of.

Probably just the Spike-hating Johnny in me though, so feel free to eat me alive; I just don't find it amusing or worth my time when a whole game is just "shuffle your deck, reveal your opening hand, explain why you already won and neither person should have wasted their time or money to play glorified Rock-Paper-Scissors"

posts.post_content:
AAAAAAAAAAGH!!!!!!!!!!!! PEOPLE ARE BAD MOUTHING THE LOTUS!!!!!!!!! IDIOTS!!!!!!!!! Ever think that maybe, just MAYBE...there is a reason black lotus is a $5000.00 card? (and the 5k is just when i last saw it a year ago, ive heard it has all but doubled in price since then.) As people have said before me, its restricted so you can only have 1 in your deck, but droping turn 1 for 0 mana to gain 3 of any color is a hell of a deal all its own, not counting the many devestating combos one can come up with for this holy grail of mtg. i forget the exact combo, but using the Power 9 (black lotus is obviously one of them), one would be able to swing for 20+ with a [Shivan Dragon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shivan Dragon) before an oponent even had a chance to play ther first land. BAck when the power 9 was widely obtainable and used by everyone, tournament games were often decided by whoever went first.
  
   
I BOW TO THEE ALL POWERFUL LOTUS!!!!!!!!!
